title: Were citizens in Soviet Russia, Maoist China, and Nazi Germany forced to display photographs of their leaders? And if so, why? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Were citizens in Soviet Russia, Maoist China, and Nazi Germany forced to display photographs of their leaders? And if so, why?” Yes. Because they had no Pledge of Allegiance.

I don’t believe there was a specific law about it. But if you get asked by a government official in Nazi Germany or the Soviet Union. I’m sure you would have to do it. Propaganda is seen as a priority in communist and Fascist states.
